title: 16-year-old in critical, Ottumwa man arrested for attempted murder
content:
OTTUMWA- Around 7:50 p.m. on Tuesday, Ottumwa Police say a 16-year-old boy was shot in the head.
Police say the teen was dropped off at the Ottumwa Regional Health Center, suffering from a gunshot wound to the head. The 16-year-old has not been identified.
He was transferred to the University of Iowa Health Center and is currently in critical condition.
On Wednesday morning, just before 1 a.m., police arrested 18-year-old Venhure Yosef Tsegay of Ottumwa and charged him with attempted murder.
Tsegay is currently being held in the Wapello County Jail on $25,000 bond.
The Iowa DCI is assisting Ottumwa Police in the investigation near Taft Circle.
Stay with Local 5 News as more information becomes available.
